result.execSummary:
The defendant David L Torkelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Fleet Farm-Wausau
At the rate of $80 per month.
No contact with Fleet Farm in Wausau.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
Probation may be transferred to Lincoln Co.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 2:59pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder.  Def appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.


PLEA:
Ct. 1 (Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST
Ct. 2 (Retail Theft)>>NO CONTEST

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.
Defendant makes statement.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on both counts; 1 year probation on each count, concurrent.
Conditions: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C with Fleet Farm in Wausau; Restitution of $904.00 to Fleet Farm in Wausau at a rate of not less than $80/month; CC.

State notes no DNA issues to be addressed in this case.

>>Probation to be transferred to Lincoln County

Status conference on June 18, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 11, 2015 at 09:45 am.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 3:05pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Kat Jackan
(Review of Evaluation)

State notes report of Dr. Galli received - Atty Jackan also notes receipt of Dr. Galli's report.
Attorney Jackan states possibility of funding for another expert; Matter is still contested.
COURT directs PTC to be scheduled in 10 days.
COURT also directs 2 day JT to be scheduled - Atty Jackan to advise if trial will be on both phases or just NGI phase.

Adj: 3:11pm
Review hearing on June 3, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 1:20pm
State appears by ADA C.Minder; Defendant appears in person and with Attorney Kat Jackan.
(STC re: report)

Parties both acknowledge recent receipt of report dated 5/1/15; COURT also has report of Dr. Engen.
Atty Jackan requests COURT order another exam by Dr. Starr at county expense, and gives information on request; Argument by State.
Atty Jackan requests Dr. Starr and State requests Dr. Galli.

COURT grants outpatient examination by Dr. Galli to be conducted at Public Defender's office in Wausau (conference room) with report to be submitted to COURT no later than May 29; Atty Jackan to draft order and advise Dr. Galli as soon as possible.
Parties to set STC shortly after 5/29/15
to Judge Grau dated 4/14/15 from Dr. Engen
Status conference on May 5, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
for Examination (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)

Clerk Cheree
Case called: 9:54am
State appears by ADA C.Minder ; Defendant appears in person and with Atty Kat Jackan
(Set for Tent Plea)

Defendant is changing his plea to NGI  per Atty Jackan - files order with the COURT
COURT accepts change of plea - questions location of outpatient examination; COURT orders the exam to occur at the State PDs office in Wausau (conference room)
COURT signs order - examiner to submit report no later than 4/26/15.

COURT REMOVES FPT date and JT date, and STC to be set shortly after 4/26

Jury Trial on April 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.  No contact with victim(s):  Fleet Farm in Wausau.   Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
